Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Call org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.text.WSDLModelAdapter.createDefinition() from a non-UI thread.
2. This results in the following stack trace:


org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.error(Display.java:1065)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.checkDevice(Display.java:660)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.getShells(Display.java:1815)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManagerUtil.getModalShellExcluding(ProgressManagerUtil.java:272)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManagerUtil.getDefaultParent(ProgressManagerUtil.java:299)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager.busyCursorWhile(ProgressManager.java:884)
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.text.WSDLModelAdapter.createDefinition(WSDLModelAdapter.java:138)

More information:
Our code performs some artifact creation in a background thread.
This involves calling the method mentioned above which leads
into the described exception.

The change for bug 150268 introduced the need for it to run in the UI thread. Did this break some existing code? The WSDLModelAdapter class is internal, not API so changes to it are to be expected.

If this method must work from a non-UI thread and to become API I would suggest converting this to an enhancement request.
*** Bug 189652 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Yes, this code is only designed to work from the UI thread and it hasn't been designed with reuse in mind.  It's not clear to me why you'd be needing to reuse this code, so perhaps some explanation of your requirements would help us guide you in the right direction.

I'm changing the status of this one to 'WONTFIX' but please continue using this bug for discussion.

This method is required to create a WSDL definition and I am not aware of any other alternative to do this. I there another (non-internal) way to create a WSDL definition?
We do this as part of a background thread, that is why it is not called from the UI thread.

Do you have a specific requirement to create the definition as the WSDL editor does? That is do you already have a DOM and want to create the definition from the DOM?

A WSDL model instance (rooted in Definition) can be loaded from a WSDL file using the typical EMF resource API. Have a look at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.util.WSDLResourceImpl.java. For examples on how it can be used look at the org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.tests plug-in which contains JUnit tests for the WSDL EMF model.

We need the definition to be created so that we can generate the Faces UI by reading from the WSDL definition. So we need to create the definition first in order to do so. Which method in WSDLResourceImpl are you referring to.

I'm sorry, but I have no idea what Faces UI is :-). Anyway, I assume you have a WSDL file somewhere and you want to load it and use the WSDL EMF model API to traverse the Definition. For an example of how you can do that please have a look at this class org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.tests.util.DefinitionLoader.
